title: Stephen Nolan salary revealed as BBC lists highest paid presenters
body_text:
Stephen Nolan's salary revealed as BBC lists highest paid presenters
The BBC’s highest-earning on-air talent has been revealed for another year
The BBC has released details of its on-air presenters' salaries - with Northern Ireland's Stephen Nolan once again listed among the top ten best paid individuals.
The corporation's newly published annual report shows that Mr Nolan was paid between £405,000 and £409,999 directly from the licence fee in 2024-25, the same salary as listed in 2023-2024.
This includes pay for his presenting work on The Nolan Show on BBC Radio Ulster, BBC Radio 5 Live and for Nolan Live on BBC TV. Mr Nolan was the seventh highest paid on-air presenter in 2024-25.
Meanwhile appearing on the list for the first time is BBC Northern Ireland's director Adam Smyth.
He was paid between £178,000 and £184,999 in 2024-25. Mr Smyth's salary was below the £178,000 threshold for disclosure in the annual report in 2023-24.
The BBC is required to publish a list of both on-air and off-air individuals who receive more than £178,000 from licence fee revenue in a year.
Elsewhere former Match Of The Day presenter Gary Lineker has topped the list of the BBC’s highest-earning on-air talent for the eighth consecutive year and the final time.
The 64-year-old, who left the BBC early at the end of the last Premier League season in May, was reported to have earned between £1,350,000 and £1,354,999 in the corporation’s latest annual report for 2024/2025, for his work on Match Of The Day and coverage of European football.
Radio presenter Zoe Ball was the second highest-paid, earning between £515,000 and £519,999, for her work on the Radio 2 Breakfast Show, which she left on December 20 last year.
She has since returned to a new Saturday afternoon show on the station, which she began hosting in May 2025.
Meanwhile, former footballer and Match Of The Day pundit Alan Shearer was the third-highest earner with a salary of between £440,000 and £444,999.
The former Newcastle United striker will continue to analyse football on the BBC in the new season with Match Of The Day’s incoming presenters Kelly Cates, Mark Chapman and Gabby Logan. His pay also covered work on the BBC’s coverage of European football competitions, such as the Uefa Champions League.
BBC Radio 1 Breakfast Show presenter Greg James came fourth on the list, earning between £425,000 and £429,999, for work which also included his Radio 4 show Rewinder, while Fiona Bruce and Nick Robinson were the joint fifth-highest earners, with both earning between £410,000 and £414,999.
The rest of the top 10 was made up of Stephen Nolan, who earned between £405,000 and £409,999, TV presenter Laura Kuenssberg, who earned between £395,000 and £399,999, BBC Radio 2 presenter Vernon Kay, who earned between £390,000 and £394,999, and journalist Justin Webb, who earned between £365,000 and £369,999.
